page.title: 02Thorpe Marsh Power Station
page.content: {Thorpe Marsh Power Station}was officially opened in 1967.The site was chosen because it satisfied these four requirements:-1.adequate source of cooling water available(River Don)2.sub strata capable of supporting heavy loads.3.good road and rail access 4. sufficient area available for ash deposition.The installation has two generators each capable of producing{500 meggawatts.}Each unit has a pulverised coal fired steam raising boiler.There are three cooling towers to each boiler.Because of silt in the River Don three{settling ponds are provided between the river pump house and the cooling water system.A total of approximately 100 tons of ash per hour is produced and this is disposed of on the station ash fields. These ash fields are the site of {Thorpe Marsh Nature Reserve.
